[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Sandwich Attack] Can an attacker sandwich the valuation transaction between pool swaps to manipulate both pool_price and oracle prices to pass slippage checks while extracting value? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: update_cetus_position_value()] [Timestamp Delay] If there's a delay between calculating the value and finishing the update (lines 27-29), can the vault's actual value change, causing stale valuations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Oracle Front-Run] Can an attacker observe oracle price updates and time their calls to update_cetus_position_value() to capture favorable valuations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [DECIMAL Constant Hardcoding] Is DECIMAL = 1e18 (line 13) compatible with all possible token decimal combinations, or could tokens with unusual decimals (e.g., 0 or 27) cause calculation errors? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: sqrt_price_x64_to_price()] [X64 Format Assumption] Does the function correctly handle all possible sqrt_price_x64 values from Cetus, including edge cases like 1, 2^64-1, or values near 0? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Decimal Mismatch Between Oracle Methods] If get_asset_price() returns prices with 18 decimals (line 50) but get_normalized_asset_price() uses different decimals (line 68), how is this reconciled in mul_with_oracle_price()? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: sqrt_price_x64_to_price()] [Precision Loss in Division] When dividing by DECIMAL (line 81) or pow(10, n) (line 86), can small sqrt prices lose all significant digits, becoming 0? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Decimal Overflow] If both decimals_a and decimals_b are 0 (lines 46-47), would the decimal adjustments at lines 84/86 become no-ops, potentially misvaluing positions? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Assertion Panic DoS] If the slippage assertion fails (lines 63-66), does this abort the entire transaction? Could an attacker deliberately cause this to DoS vault operations requiring position valuations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: update_cetus_position_value()] [Get Asset Failure] What happens if get_defi_asset() doesn't find an asset matching asset_type (line 26)? Does it revert or return a default value that could be misused? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Pool Read Failure] What if pool.get_position_amounts() or pool.current_sqrt_price() revert due to pool being paused or position not existing? Can this be weaponized for DoS? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Config Missing Decimals] If config.coin_decimals() reverts for unknown token types (lines 46-47), can this DoS all position valuations? Should there be a default decimal value? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Config Missing Slippage] If config.dex_slippage() is not set or returns an invalid value, how does the assertion at line 63-66 behave? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Diff Function Implementation] The diff() function on u256 (line 64) is called but not defined in this file. Does it compute absolute difference |a-b|, max(a,b)-min(a,b), or something else? Could this affect slippage checks? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: sqrt_price_x64_to_price()] [Pow Function Behavior] Does std::u256::pow() handle overflow by wrapping, capping, or reverting? This affects safety of pow(10, n) calls at lines 84/86. (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Mul With Oracle Price Implementation] How does vault_utils::mul_with_oracle_price() handle decimal normalization (lines 71-72)? Could mismatched assumptions cause value calculation errors? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: sqrt_price_x64_to_price()] [Integer Division Rounding] Does the division at line 81 and 86 round down (floor), and could this systematically undervalue positions over time? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Slippage Base Hardcoding] Is SLIPPAGE_BASE = 10000 (line 15) universally compatible with all potential dex_slippage() return values, or could config return values in different bases (e.g., 100 or 1000000)? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Slippage Zero Denominator] In DECIMAL * slippage / SLIPPAGE_BASE (line 64), if SLIPPAGE_BASE were somehow modified to 0, would this cause division by zero? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Slippage Scale Mismatch] If config.dex_slippage() returns a value > SLIPPAGE_BASE (>10000), could the calculation at line 64 produce a threshold > DECIMAL, making the slippage check meaningless? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Pool Parameter Substitution] Can an attacker provide a malicious pool with the same types CoinA/CoinB but different parameters/state to manipulate valuations (line 34)? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: update_cetus_position_value()] [Pool Reference Staleness] If the pool reference is obtained earlier and pool state changes before update_cetus_position_value() is called, could this cause misvaluations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Pool Upgrade Attack] If the Cetus protocol is upgraded and pool behavior changes, could old adaptors calculating values incorrectly still be used? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Multiple Pools Same Pair] If multiple Cetus pools exist for the same CoinA/CoinB pair with different fees/parameters, can passing the wrong pool cause incorrect valuations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Object ID Spoofing] Can object::id(position) at line 39 be manipulated if someone creates a fake position object with a specific ID to match a valuable position in the pool? (High)
